properties.areaDesc: Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 9 at 4:00AM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW WEST AND CENTRAL TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING...
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW...WINDY AND COLDER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH
TUESDAY NIGHT...

.A passing disturbance and cold front will combine to bring light
snow to portions of western and central New Mexico later tonight
through Monday morning before a brief break in the weather Monday
afternoon. Monday night through Tuesday night, a significant
winter storm is appearing likely for northern and central New
Mexico. Moderate to heavy snowfall, strong and gusty winds and
colder temperatures will create travel impacts region wide.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, total snow accumulations
of 2 to 5 inches are possible later tonight through midday
Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow with
accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, with locally higher amounts.
Winds gusting as high as 40 mph are possible across the Sandia
and Manzano Mountains Tuesday.

* WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Sandia and Manzano
Mountains including Edgewood.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to
noon MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday
afternoon through Tuesday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Monday
night through Tuesday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
